sen.j: 柴田 家門（しばた かもん、1863年2月6日（文久2年12月18日 (旧暦)） - 1919年（大正8年）8月25日）は、文部大臣、貴族院議員などを務めた政治家。
sen.e: Kamon SHIBATA (February 6, 1863 - August 25, 1919) was a politician who was a Education Minister and a member of the House of Peers.
Kamon SHIBATA (February 6, 1863 - August 25, 1919) is a statesman who served as Education Minister, a member of the House of Peers, and so on.
Kamon SHIBATA (February 6, 1863 - August 25, 1919) is a statesman who served as Education Minister, a member of the House of Peers, and so on.

sen.j: 萩城下平安古（現在の山口県萩市平安古東区）に柴田英佐（えいすけ）の長男として出生。
sen.e: He was born to Eisuke SUGIBATA as the first son in Heianinishie in the castle town of Hagi (present Hagi City, Yamaguchi Prefecture).
He was born to Eisuke SHIBATA as the first son at Heian-inishie in the castle town of Hagi (present Hagi City, Yamaguchi Prefecture).
sen.cmt: SUGIBATAをSHIBATAに, in Heianinishieをat Heian-inishieに変更
sen.e: He was born to Eisuke SHIBATA as the first son at Heian-inishie in the castle town of Hagi (present Hagi City, Yamaguchi Prefecture).

sen.j: 同郷に田中義一、藤井幸槌がいる。
sen.e: Giichi TANAKA and Kotsuchi FUJII were from same province.
Giichi TANAKA and Kotsuchi FUJII were from the same province.
Giichi TANAKA and Kotsuchi FUJII were from the same province.

sen.j: 1882年（明治15年）に上京し、大学予備門（第一高等中学校、現在の東京大学教養学部）を経て、東京大学法科大学（現在の東京大学法学部）に進学。
sen.e: In 1882, he studied in Tokyo by enrolling at the Daigakuyobimon (Daiichi Koto Chugakko) First High School, present day The University of Tokyo, Faculty of Liberal Arts before advancing to the law school of Tokyo University (present the faculty of law at Tokyo University).

In 1882, he came up to Tokyo and enrolled at Daigakuyobimon (Daiichi Koto Chugakko (First High School), The present University of Tokyo, Faculty of Liberal Arts) before advancing to the law school of Tokyo University (The present faculty of law at Tokyo University).

In 1882, he came up to Tokyo and enrolled at Daigakuyobimon (Daiichi Koto Chugakko (First High School), The present University of Tokyo, Faculty of Liberal Arts) before advancing to the law school of Tokyo University (The present faculty of law at Tokyo University).

sen.j: 1890年、同大学卒業後、内閣書記官、法制局参事官、行政裁判所評定官等を務める。
sen.e: After graduation from the school in 1890, he was appointed to Secretary of the Cabinet, Secretary to Cabinet Legislation Bureau and a consultation officer for a public administrative court.
After graduation from the university in 1890, he served as Secretary of the Cabinet, Counsellor of Cabinet Legislation Bureau and a consultation officer for a public administrative court.
After graduation from the university in 1890, he served as Secretary of the Cabinet, Counsellor of Cabinet Legislation Bureau and a consultation officer for a public administrative court.

sen.j: 1898年、第2次山縣内閣の内務省 (日本)地方局長を務める。
sen.e: He was appointed to the chief of Bureau of Areas at prewar Ministry of Home Affairs for the second term cabinet of Prime Minister Yamagata in 1898.
He was appointed to the chief of Bureau of Areas at Ministry of Home Affairs in the second Yamagata cabinet in 1898.
He was appointed to the chief of Bureau of Areas at Ministry of Home Affairs in the second Yamagata cabinet in 1898.

sen.j: 1901年、第1次桂内閣の内閣書記官長に就任。
sen.e: In 1901, he assumed the position of Secretary of the Cabinet for the First Katsura Cabinet.
In 1901, he assumed the position of Secretary of the Cabinet for the First Katsura Cabinet.
In 1901, he assumed the position of Secretary of the Cabinet for the First Katsura Cabinet.

sen.j: 1903年、勅撰の貴族院議員となる。
sen.e: In 1903, he became a member of the House of Peers by a compilation by Imperial command.
In 1903, he became a member of the House of Peers by a compilation by Imperial command.
In 1903, he became a member of the House of Peers by a compilation by Imperial command.

sen.j: 1908年、第2次桂内閣の内閣書記官長に就任。
sen.e: In 1908, he assumed the position of Secretary of the Cabinet for the Second Katsura Cabinet.
In 1908, he assumed the position of Secretary of the Cabinet for the Second Katsura Cabinet.
In 1908, he assumed the position of Secretary of the Cabinet for the Second Katsura Cabinet.
In 1911, he concurrently served as the president of Bureau of Reclamation and Colonization.
In 1911, he concurrently served as the president of Takushoku-kyoku (Bureau of Reclamation and Colonization).
In 1911, he concurrently served as the president of Takushoku-kyoku (Bureau of Reclamation and Colonization).

sen.j: 1912年、第3次桂内閣の文部大臣に就任。
sen.e: In 1912, he assumed the position of Education Minister for the Third Katsura Cabinet.
In 1912, he assumed the position of Education Minister for the Third Katsura Cabinet.
In 1912, he assumed the position of Education Minister for the Third Katsura Cabinet.

sen.j: 退任後も貴族院議員を務め、臨時教育会議の委員を務める。
sen.e: After leaving the cabinet position, he served as a member of the House of Peers and also as a member to the temporary Education Commission.
After leaving the cabinet position, he served as a member of the House of Peers and also as a member of the temporary Education Commission.
sen.cmt: a member to the temporary Education Commission --> a member of the temporary Education Commission
sen.e: After leaving the cabinet position, he served as a member of the House of Peers and also as a member of the temporary Education Commission.
He died in 1919.
He died in 1919.
He died in 1919.

sen.j: 墓所は東京都港区の青山霊園にある。
sen.e: His place of burial is located in Aoyama cemetery.
His graveyard is in Aoyama cemetery in Minato Ward, Tokyo.
sen.cmt: 訳漏れあり。「東京都港区」の部分を追加。その他表現の見直し
sen.e: His graveyard is in Aoyama cemetery in Minato Ward, Tokyo.
